messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Ishida Mitsunari
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hello! Welcome to the group. ... You re right - there s not much in English out there. Here is a little something. I hope this helps a little.
messages.messageBody:
On Fri, 09 Jul 2004 00:52:08 -0000, rjuriさん wrote:

>This is my first post to this forum, so let me begin this with a
>hello.
Hello! Welcome to the group.

>Could someone share with me information, or sources of that (pages),
>about this man? I mean, not only that was the one that lead the
>western army at Sekigahara. I mean, about his family, about his
>career, love, battles, intrigue, etc.

You're right - there's not much in English out there. Here is a
little something. I hope this helps a little.

http://www.trentu.ca/tja/sengoku/famousnames/ishida.html

Good luck and have fun!

--
Jay Kelly
oyakata@...

messages.subject: Ishida Mitsunari
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings: This is my first post to this forum, so let me begin this with a hello. I ve been looking for some good infromation about the life of Ishida
messages.messageBody:
Greetings:

This is my first post to this forum, so let me begin this with a
hello.
I've been looking for some good infromation about the life of Ishida
Mitsunari. I didn't found much in the Samurai Archives, nor in other
pages in google.
Could someone share with me information, or sources of that (pages),
about this man? I mean, not only that was the one that lead the
western army at Sekigahara. I mean, about his family, about his
career, love, battles, intrigue, etc.
Thanks in advance.

Rodrigo Juri A.
